//: Class currently is male/female but will expand to dog/robot/mutant... whatever needs its own ending
Unique means the ending will only occur when assigned to an creature, not randomly.
Below you can write text or DRAW (76x20).  The creatures name will be inserted at the *.
line_09: Died several years later at the hands of a Hell's Raiders band.  Till
line_10: the end, he held out hope that his daughter was still alive in the
line_11: wasteland.

line_09: Was making his way to Michigan to search for family when he broke his
line_10: leg in the woods.  Died of hypothermia a week later.  A note found with his
line_11: body read, 'I wish I could have saved her.'

line_09: Survived for a number of years and made a name for himself amongst
line_10: other survivors.  Eventually he began augmenting himself with bionics...
line_11: when a failed surgery left him permanently blind he committed suicide
line_12: without leaving a note.

line_09: Met with some success as a craftsman working in a small survivor
line_10: outpost.  Eventually he married a young refugee and had two children.  Died
line_11: during a typhoid outbreak a few years later.  Survived by only his three
line_12: year old son.

line_09: Became a skilled mechanic and assisted a number of refugees searching
line_10: for settlements.  He left one day on a routine trading run and failed to
line_11: return.  His wrecked truck was located by a scavenger band but he was never
line_12: seen again.

line_09: Became a game hunter and trapper.  Eventually he left on a hunting trip
line_10: never to be seen again.  Attempts to locate him were called off when one of
line_11: the searchers disappeared without a trace.

line_09: Went on to enlist in the Old Guard.  Was killed in action a year later
line_10: fighting the Hell's Raiders in Vermont.  In his will he requested that all
line_11: entitlements and property be transferred to a young lady he had met while
line_12: guarding a FEMA camp.  Was survived by the young lady and a newborn son.

line_09: Became a laborer for hire in any outpost that needed assistance.  Was
line_10: hanged for stealing from an employer; weeks later it was revealed the
line_11: employer never had the resources nor intention to pay him.

line_09: Never spent much time around settlements after your death.  Was last
line_10: seen near the Adirondacks in New York.

line_09: Died of an infected bite a few weeks later.  Before he passed he told
line_10: those present, 'Now I've lost everything in this world... but you haven't.
line_11: Keep searching, the world is big enough that there has to be a place out
line_12: there that hasn't been overrun.'

line_09: Managed to contract some form of fungal infection a few months after
line_10: your passing.  Unable to find treatment, he asked to be put down while
line_11: listening to someone read from his favorite novel, Don Quixote.

line_09: Became a self-taught chemist and medic.  His work eventually led him to
line_10: a life of alcohol abuse and morphine addiction.  Overdosed one night when
line_11: left unattended.  The community he helped said, 'He was probably the best
line_12: thing to happen to us in years... there just isn't any turning back when you
line_13: lose all hope.'

line_09: Went on to become a notable scout and urban explorer.  Was tragically
line_10: killed when cornered in an abandoned store when scavenging with a group of
line_11: unskilled survivors.

line_09: After your death he became a reclusive but friendly guy.  His continued
line_10: supply runs helped keep many survivor colonies alive through the years.
line_11: Unfortunately, he bled to death over the course of several days after
line_12: having stepped on a landmine intended to target local raiders.

line_09: Lost his way long before he met you.  The cataclysm offered him the
line_10: chance to denounce the former vices that had led to his incarceration... an
line_11: offer that went unanswered.  After you were killed, he returned to hunting
line_12: those he saw as weak.  The number of people he murdered is unknown but prior
line_13: to his execution he claimed that, 'butchering the dead was never as fun as

line_09: Found new meaning in life after your death.  Although he never informed
line_10: you, his felonies in the departed world had prevented him from ever having
line_11: a real place in society.  With the destruction of existing criminal records,
line_12: he took it upon himself to prove his worth to his fellow man.  Died from a
line_13: heart attack while alone on a trip many years after the cataclysm.

line_09: Spent his entire life secretly addicted to one substance or another.
line_10: After your death he briefly worked as a laborer in a survivor camp before
line_11: losing his grip on reality due to various side effects associated with his
line_12: drugs of choice.  He died from complications due to a seizure.  In his last
line_13: moments he saw Porkey the pig exclaim, 'That's all folks!' before an

line_09: Was never known as a particularly brave individual nor an emotionally
line_10: stable one.  His regret for not helping people during the opening days of
line_11: the cataclysm led him to attempt suicide multiple times in the years that
line_12: followed.  Life improved briefly when he married a fellow survivor but was
line_13: shattered when his spouse was killed by members of a mysterious apocalypse
line_14: cult.  He was killed when he attempted to sneak into the cult's compound to

line_09: Spent the remainder of his life assisting one adventurer party or
line_10: another.  Eventually his luck ran out when he became ill after eating
line_11: something rotten.  Was abandoned by his party in an infested neighborhood,
line_12: never to be seen again.

line_09: Died from sepsis a few weeks after you.  The cut on his leg that
line_10: ultimately killed him would have been easily treatable in nearly any other
line_11: situation.  His final wish was that he be allowed to drink himself into his
line_12: grave.  Upon consideration, the party that he was with opted to shoot him in
line_13: the head and divide his belongings rather than waste the alcohol.

line_09: Worked hard following your death to organize his own band of survivors.
line_10: Went on to marry and have two children that were raised and taught every
line_11: survival skill they would ever need.  His past eventually caught up to him
line_12: when he ran afoul with an Old Guard colonel.  Since he fled his post as a
line_13: National Guard soldier during the cataclysm he was hanged for desertion
line_14: despite the protests of a huge number of survivors that had benefited from

line_09: Went on to the coast and salvaged a small sailboat.  Despite the
line_10: protests of those that knew him, his decision to sail in search of some
line_11: uninhabited tropical paradise in the north Atlantic was final.  His
line_12: disappearance after starting the journey was described by his fellow
line_13: survivors as 'a waste of a perfectly good boat.'

line_09: Within a few weeks of your death he was robbed by a pair of bandits.
line_10: For attempting to resist their demands they broke both of his arms in
line_11: multiple places.  Alone and wounded it took nearly a month before he found
line_12: refuge and primitive medical assistance with other survivors.  Having lost
line_13: his ability to grasp or lift, he spent the last few years of his life
line_14: begging for food and relying on charity from his fellow survivors.

line_09: Trained under your guidance, he became a renowned abomination hunter.
line_10: With what weapons he could salvage he led parties to reclaim town after town
line_11: from the undead and other horrors that wandered the wasteland.  His success
line_12: was temporal as monsters migrated into the cleared territories as quickly as
line_13: he could clear them.  His life ended when antibiotic resistant infection
line_14: spread between his countless minor wounds.

line_09: Renounced the adventurous lifestyle after your death and chose to
line_10: establish a self sufficient camp away from the horrors found in the old
line_11: cities.  His attempts at solitude were in vain as otherworldly visitors
line_12: began to prey upon the weak and isolated.  The last moments of his life were
line_13: spent in bewilderment and horror as he was awoken one night to an alien
line_14: insect the size of a man opening his cabin's door and screaming in a dozen
line_15: perfectly human voices as it flew straight at him.

line_09: Was detained and handcuffed by a police robot on multiple counts of
line_10: looting and vandalism that were tracked and recorded by the few remaining
line_11: security systems.  While being held on the ground awaiting additional police
line_12: response units he was torn to pieces by the undead that were attracted by
line_13: the commotion.

line_09: Committed suicide rather than fall into the hands of the Hell's
line_10: Raiders.  Till the end, she held out hope that her son was still alive in
line_11: the wasteland.

line_09: Was making her way to Ohio to search for family when she consumed a
line_10: number of poisonous roots.  Over the course of three or four days she
line_11: passed.  A note found with her body read, 'I wish I could have saved him.'

line_09: Survived for a number of years and made a name for herself amongst
line_10: other survivors.  Eventually she began experimenting with mutagen... when a
line_11: mutation left her permanently disfigured and in pain she committed suicide
line_12: without leaving a note.

line_09: Met with some success as a craftswoman working in a small survivor
line_10: outpost.  Eventually she married a refugee and had one child.  Died during
line_11: childbirth a few years later.  Survived by her husband and two year old
line_12: daughter.

line_09: Became a skilled mechanic and assisted a number of refugees searching
line_10: for settlements.  She left one day driving a number of migrants to another
line_11: settlement when she disappeared.  No trace of her or the vehicle was ever
line_12: found.

line_09: Became a game hunter and trapper.  Eventually she left on a hunting
line_10: trip never to be seen again.  Attempts to locate her were called off when a
line_11: shredded jacket was found.

line_09: Went on to enlist in the Old Guard.  Was captured a year later fighting
line_10: the Hell's Raiders in the disastrous Vermont campaign.  The hasty rescue
line_11: mission that followed was one of the major defeats that forced the Old Guard
line_12: to abandon the area.  It is unknown if she survived.

line_09: Became a laborer for hire in any outposts that needed assistance.  Was
line_10: wrongly shot by her employer during a wage dispute.

line_09: Never spent much time around settlements after your death.  Was last
line_10: seen near the old Canadian border.

line_09: Died of an infected bite a few weeks later.  Before she passed she told
line_10: those present, 'I've outlived everyone that I have ever loved.  If anything,
line_11: death is a few months late'.

line_09: Managed to contract some form of infection a few months after your
line_10: passing.  Unable to find treatment she asked to be put down while listening
line_11: to someone read from her favorite novel, A Tale of Two Cities.

line_09: Became a self-taught chemist and medic.  Her work eventually led her to
line_10: a life of alcohol abuse and morphine addicion.  Overdosed one night when
line_11: left unattended.  The community she helped said, 'I've never known a nicer
line_12: woman nor one who had fought off depression for so long.'

line_09: Went on to become a notable scout and urban explorer.  Was tragically
line_10: killed by one of her students when leading a group of unskilled survivors
line_11: on a night supply raid.

line_09: After your death she became a reclusive and eccentric individual.  Her
line_10: skills were invaluable to the outposts that she chose to assist.
line_11: Unfortunately, competition for resources and salvage rights led a group of
line_12: survivors to coax a mob of undead to surround her when she was on a lone
line_13: raid.  Without witnesses, no connection between her death and the other

line_11: offer that went unanswered.  After you were killed, she returned to preying
line_12: upon those she saw as weak.  It is rumored that she robbed dozens of
line_13: survivors for everything they had before leaving them to die amongst the
line_14: horrors that roamed the land.  Her eventual fate is unknown.

line_09: Spent her entire life secretly addicted to one substance or another.
line_10: After your death she briefly worked in a survivor camp before finding a
line_11: place in the lucrative drug trade.  She died, predictably, from an overdose.
line_12: Drugs allowed her to relive the memories of friends, family, and loved
line_13: ones... she died happier than could have ever been expected.

line_09: Was never known as a particularly brave individual nor an emotionally
line_10: stable one.  Her inability to emotionally conform to life after the
line_11: cataclysm led her to attempt suicide multiple times in the years that
line_12: followed.  Attracted by promises of renewal and the prospect of belonging to
line_13: a new family, she became involved with a charismatic cult.  She was an
line_14: innocent casualty when Old Guard soldiers stormed the compound on suspicion

line_09: Spent the remainder of her life assisting one adventurer party or
line_10: another.  Eventually her luck ran out when she became ill after starvation
line_11: led her to eat whatever she could forage from the woods.  The party she was
line_12: with deemed her a lost cause and put a bullet in her head instead of letting
line_13: her turn.  She had suffered from a treatable form of marasmus.

line_09: Was stabbed in the arm by an ill tempered survivor a few weeks after
line_10: you passed.  The cut quickly became infected and she died from sepsis a
line_11: short time later.  Her murderer was the first person to discover her
line_12: corpse... and all the gear she had been saving.

line_09: Worked hard following your death to build her own band of survivors.
line_10: Thanks to the skills she had acquired, she was able to turn a hefty profit
line_11: looting abandoned towns.  After a series of heated contract disputes with
line_12: her followers she found herself locked in her own car as a pair of molotovs
line_13: were thrown through the windows.  Her last desire was that she could have
line_14: taken the bastards out with her.

line_09: Sought the coast in the hopes of finding an abandoned ship after your
line_10: death.  Her journey ended when she discovered an Old Guard controlled dock
line_11: in an abandoned fishing town.  Promised a new life if she agreed to serve as
line_12: a contractor, she spent the next few years toiling to keep the camp supplied
line_13: but never saw her reward.  A stray bullet struck her down when the Hell's
line_14: Raiders launched a raid in an attempt to gain access to the sea.

line_09: Within a few months of your death she was robbed by a group of bandits.
line_10: When she shot the first dead in his tracks, one of his companions unleashed
line_11: a blast from his flamethrower at close range.  Her ashes and a few odd
line_12: pieces of jewelry were all that could be recovered.

line_09: Trained under your guidance, she became a renowned monster hunter.
line_10: Leading a band of warriors armed with primitive weapons she tracked down and
line_11: killed numerous otherworldly horrors that wandered the wilderness.  Her
line_12: quest to end the threat led her party to a shimmering gate that appeared to
line_13: spew forth abominations and alien material.  With no means of closing the
line_14: gate, her party was last seen venturing into the unknown to meet the threat

line_09: Renounced the adventurous lifestyle after your death and chose to start
line_10: a family with a fellow survivor in an abandoned hunting cabin.  Survival was
line_11: grim but the family grew through the years until she had three sons and a
line_12: daughter.  Her end came when the horrors finally located her homestead...
line_13: she and her husband were able to distract the monster as her children

line_09: Was detained and incarcerated by a police robot on multiple counts of
line_10: looting and vandalism that were tracked and recorded by the few remaining
line_11: security systems.  Trapped in a cell awaiting police review, she spent weeks
line_12: crying out for help and slowly consuming what supplies she carried.  Two
line_13: weeks after being dragged to her cell she died from dehydration.
